item.title: Mentioned by Globalnews.ca
item.description:
Sask. MP wants tougher penalties for bus driver attacks
REGINA â€“ Saskatchewan's lone Liberal M-P wants to toughen penalties for anyone who attacks a bus driver. Ralph Goodale says he would like to get a private member's bill passed that would strengthen Criminal Code sentences for people convicted of ...

item.title: Mentioned by Ottawa Citizen
item.description:
Legislation for bus drivers needs support, says Ralph Goodale
Bus drivers and their union representatives met Ralph Goodale for a round-table discussion where the MP for Saskatchewan's Wascana riding stressed the importance of garnering widespread support for Bill C-533, which aims to stiffen penalties for anyone ...

item.title: Mentioned by Ottawa Citizen
item.description:
Legislation to protect bus drivers needs support, says Ralph Goodale
The talk was organized by Ralph Goodale, the MP for Saskatchewan's Wascana riding who created a private member's bill designed to protect on-duty bus drivers against assaults. Goodale said Bill C-533, which is designed to stiffen penalties for anyone ...

item.title: Mentioned by Chilliwack Progress
item.description:
Veteran Liberal Ralph Goodale is coming to Chilliwack
Now Liberal MP Ralph Goodale, a former finance minister and deputy leader of the Opposition in the House of Commons, is planning to attend Party in the Park in Central Community Park on August 23. "All across the country there is growing momentum ...

item.title: Mentioned by News Talk 980 CJME
item.description:
Goodale defends Nigerian students facing deportation
Saskatchewan's lone Liberal M.P., Ralph Goodale, is on the girls' side. He says the federal government has shown no flexibility on the issue. "The fact that they (Ordu and Amadi) are in the situation that they are in now, is entirely a product of the government's ...
